metadata.title: CVE-2016-2329 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
libavcodec/tiff.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.6 does not properly validateRowsPerStrip values and YCbCr chrominance subsampling factors, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access)or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF file, relatedto the tiff_decode_tag and decode_frame functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
